Job Posting:167198 - Position: S25 Intern, Software Developer 167198 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 03/04/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 02/18/2025 04:08 PM Expired ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Zimmer Biomet 1800 West Center Street Warsaw 46581-0708 IN JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2025 - Summer S25 Intern, Software Developer 167198 Co-op Position Montreal, QB Canada 4 months CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Job Title: 2025 Summer Intern, Software Developer Job ID: 4350 At Zimmer Biomet, we believe in pushing the boundaries of innovation and driving our mission forward. As a global medical technology leader for nearly 100 years, a patient's mobility is enhanced by a Zimmer Biomet product or technology every 8 seconds. As a Zimmer Biomet team member, you will share in our commitment to providing mobility and renewed life to people around the world. To support our talented team, we focus on development opportunities, robust employee resource groups (ERGs), a flexible working environment, location specific competitive total rewards, wellness incentives and a culture of recognition and performance awards. We are committed to creating an environment where every team member feels inspired, invested, cared for, valued, and have a strong sense of belonging. What You Can Expect Position Summary Under the supervision of the Software Development Manager, you will contribute to the software development of the second generation of the ROSA System, a robotic platform designed to assist surgeons in the placement of instruments and implants in the brain. How You'll Create Impact Role and Responsibilities • Develop and implement user-friendly front-end interfaces using HTML/CSS, Angular, and TypeScript • Perform required tests and document the results • Write quality documentation necessary for product commercialization (design requirements, risk analysis, etc.) • In an Agile environment, be responsible for: • Tracking time spent on tasks • Providing time estimates for task planning Identifying potential roadblocks • Job Requirements Your Background Education/Experience Requirements B.S. in engineering being pursued; completed sophomore status or higher • Skills and Abilities • You are bilingual (French and English, both written and spoken).. • You have knowledge of Angular/TypeScript, HTML, and CSS. • You are familiar with version control systems such as Git/GitLab. • You have a passion for solving complex problems. • You are a proactive individual capable of efficiently managing multiple tasks in parallel while respecting priorities and deadlines. • You have strong teamwork skills and can work effectively in a multidisciplinary team. • You are detail-oriented, have strong analytical skills, and can produce precise, concise, and accurate reports and documentation. You are recognized for your excellent communication skills. You have a strong interest in the orthopedic field and in improving people's quality of life. • • Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://careers.zimmerbiomet.com/us/en/job/4350/2025-Summer-Intern-Software-Developer Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
